title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, objectives, and requirements for the NeuralDustProgrammer project. Gather input from stakeholders, including medical professionals, researchers, and potential users.

title: System Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture for the NeuralDustProgrammer, including components for programming, updating, monitoring, data management, security, and scalability. Consider the following aspects: 1) Programming interface for neural dust implants, 2) Update mechanisms for implant firmware/software, 3) Monitoring and data collection from implants, 4) Data storage and processing pipelines, 5) Security and privacy considerations, 6) Scalability and performance requirements, 7) Integration with existing healthcare systems, 8) User interfaces for different stakeholders (patients, healthcare providers, researchers).

title: Security and Privacy Considerations
description: Evaluate security and privacy concerns related to neural dust implants and develop strategies to ensure data protection, user privacy, and compliance with relevant regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR). Address potential risks such as unauthorized access, data breaches, and misuse of personal health information. Propose robust encryption, access control mechanisms, and secure communication protocols. Develop policies and procedures for data handling, storage, and disposal. Implement privacy-by-design principles and provide user controls for data sharing and consent management.

title: Backend Development
description: Develop the backend components for programming, updating, and monitoring neural dust implants, including APIs, data processing, and integration with external systems.

title: Frontend Development
description: Design and develop user interfaces for programming, updating, and monitoring neural dust implants, ensuring a seamless and intuitive experience.
